Question 99) Although nuclear energy can be used for peaceful purposes, recent geopolitical conflicts have brought concerns in various parts of the planet and encouraged discussions aimed at combating the use of mass destruction weapons. In addition to the destructive potential of the atomic bomb, a major concern associated with the use of this war artifact is the radioactive dust left after the pump is detonated.
What is the process involved in the detonation of this pump?
A) Nuclear fission of uranium, caused by neutrons.
B) nuclear fusion of hydrogen, caused by protons.
C) nuclear disintegration of plutonium caused by electrons.
D) lead chain association, caused by positron.
E) carbon radioactive decay caused by beta particles.
